title: Coronavirus: The British-Pakistani doctors saving lives in both countries
description: From his laptop in Essex, Dr Tahir Akhtar is advising Pakistani doctors on treating coronavirus patients.

title: Danny Trejo: The actor who went from prisoner to film star
description: A new documentary looks at how Danny Trejo left his criminal past to become a film star.

title: Nile Dam row: Egypt and Ethiopia generate heat but no power
description: Egypt sees the dam as an existential threat, while Ethiopia sees it as an existential necessity.

title: Black Lives Matter: From social media post to global movement
description: Black Lives Matter has sparked a hashtag, grass-roots organisations, and a collective of activists.

title: Coronavirus: How New Zealand went 'hard and early' to beat Covid-19
description: What has been the strategy behind New Zealand's Covid-19 success?

title: Quiz of the week: What annoyed Tom Hanks?
description: How closely have you been paying attention to what's been going on during the past seven days?

title: Coronavirus: An induction to post-lockdown gyms
description: The CEO of Total Fitness, Sophie Lawler, shows how one of her gyms has been adapted for coronavirus.

title: Coronavirus: 'Big fat British Asian weddings' forced to slim down
description: How has the coronavirus pandemic hit the Asian weddings industry in the UK?

title: Coronavirus: What do shoppers think about wearing face coverings?
description: Shoppers in Edinburgh give their opinion as new regulations come into force in Scotland.

title: Why Hollywood needs computer games tech more than ever
description: The same technology that runs computer games is increasingly popular for making films and television.

title: Coronavirus in Scotland: Fears that economic scars will run deep
description: Borrowed billions are propping up the economy, but some fear the economic scars will be long-lasting.

title: Coronavirus: How Mexican cartels are taking advantage of pandemic
description: The BBC has secured exclusive access to a cartel trying to win over the poor during the pandemic.

title: Rishi Sunak: The 'whatever it takes' chancellor
description: He's been dubbed "Dishy Rishi" and "an economic Jedi" but who is the man steering the UK economy?

title: Premier League predictions: Lawro v The Manor's Scotty Stacks
description: Mark Lawrenson takes on The Manor rapper & Crystal Palace fan Scotty Stacks to make predictions for this week's Premier League games.

title: Abusive behaviour completely normalised, say Olympians Becky and Ellie Downie
description: British Olympians Becky and Ellie Downie say abusive behaviour in their gymnastics training became "so ingrained in our daily lives that that it was completely normalised".

title: 'I'm furious that we can't reopen'
description: Beauty salons and gyms in England get a date to reopen but some treatments remain blacklisted.

title: Noah Lyles: 200m 'world record' ruled out... because he only ran 185m
description: Noah Lyles briefly appeared to have set an astonishing new 200m world record - beating Usain Bolt's best by 0.29 seconds - before it was revealed he had run 15m short.

title: John Lewis: Watford store closure 'incredibly sad for our town'
description: How will the loss of a store giant affect one town's high street?

title: Coronavirus: Gym-owning Manningtree couple's relief at reopening plan
description: Jack and Connie Cardy cannot wait to get back to running the gym they gambled everything on to open.

title: Tax boss questions value of Rishi Sunak's job bonus and meal discount plans
description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak rejected fears job retention bonus and meal discount are not value for taxpayers.

title: John Lewis and Boots to cut 5,300 jobs and shut shops
description: A day after the chancellor unveils a plan to save jobs, two of the UK's biggest retailers announce cuts.

title: Bow crane collapse: Killed woman was 'very caring'
description: Specialist workers are still working to recover June Harvey's body from one of the damaged houses.

title: 'UK faces mobile blackouts if Huawei 5G ban imposed by 2023'
description: BT and Vodafone warn that users will face days without a mobile signal if a 2023 ban is imposed.

title: Do I need a TV licence and what does it pay for?
description: Most over-75s will be required to pay for the licence fee from August 1

title: TV licences: BBC to go ahead with over-75s licence fee changes
description: More than three million households will be asked to start paying the £157.50 fee from 1 August.

title: England v West Indies: Ben Stokes dropped as Kemar Roach spills a running catch
description: Ben Stokes is dropped on 14 as Kemar Roach spills a running catch off the bowling of Alzarri Joseph on day two of the first Test between England and West Indies.

title: Coronavirus: Indoor visits and overnight stays to be allowed in Scotland
description: First Minister Nicola Sturgeon confirms the move to "phase three" of her government's route map out of lockdown.

title: All Welsh pupils 'back in school full-time' in September
description: Wales' education minister says pupils will not have to socially distance with their peers in class.

title: Coronavirus: Taxes will rise to pay for virus, IFS think tank warns
description: The chancellor's huge economic support schemes will have to be paid for via higher taxes, the IFS says.

title: England v Ireland: Hosts call up nine uncapped players
description: England name nine uncapped players in a 24-man training group for the three-match ODI series against Ireland.

title: US student visas: 'A lot of students I know are scared for the future'
description: International students at US universities talk about the uncertainty immigration changes have caused.

title: Coronavirus: Asymptomatic testing for taxi drivers and cleaners in England
description: A pilot in England will test people without symptoms working in 'high-contact' jobs.

title: Is rum about to become the new gin?
description: As a small but growing number of new rum distilleries open, is the spirit set to see a sales boom?

title: Gorillas in Nigeria: World's rarest great ape pictured with babies
description: The sighting of young Cross River gorillas in Nigeria eases fears they will soon die out.

title: England v West Indies: Shannon Gabriel bowls Joe Denly for 18

description: A search is to resume a day after Rivera's young son is found alone in a boat on a California lake.

description: Lizzie Kelly, the first woman to ride a Grade One winner over jumps in Britain, is halting her jockey career to start a family.

description: Britain's most successful road cyclist Chris Froome is to leave Team Ineos at the end of the season.

description: Wigan Athletic boss Paul Cook describes the club's administration as "the worst, toughest week of my career".

title: UK universities comply with China's internet restrictions
description: But universities reject that tests on online learning in China are accepting "censorship".

description: BBC Sport looks back at two remarkable Wimbledon champions who surprised everyone - but who was the most unlikely winner?

description: Rishi Sunak's coronavirus recovery plan is greeted with praise and concern on the front pages.

title: Fergal Keane: My family and the empire's complex legacy
description: The BBC's Fergal Keane looks at Ireland's colonial past and the allegiances his relatives had within it.

title: Me Too founder Tarana Burke: Movement is not over
description: Tarana Burke says jailing Harvey Weinstein was "astonishing" but not what the campaign is about.

title: Pop music is getting faster (and happier)
description: After years of slower beats and introspective lyrics, pop is becoming optimistic again. Here's why.
